content:
• Tuesday, June 18, 2019
  • KURA

    Kura Oncology prices stock offering

    • Kura Oncology (NASDAQ:KURA) has priced its public offering of 5.9M common shares at $17/share, for gross proceeds of $100.3M.
    • Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 0.885M ADS.
    • Closing date is June 21.
    • KURA -7% after hours to $17.45
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 PM
  • CALA

    Calithera Biosciences prices stock offering

    • Calithera Biosciences (NASDAQ:CALA) has priced its public offering of 12.5M common shares at $4/share, for gross proceeds of $50M.
    • Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 1.875M common shares.
    • Closing date is June 21.
    • CALA -5.3% after hours to $4.49
    • Source: Press Release
    • Prior:Â Calithera Biosciences readies secondary offering
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • WFTBF

    Cutbacks at Canadian saw mills send lumber prices surging

    • Lumber prices continued their sharp recent climb after West Fraser Timber (OTCPK:WFTBF) said it planned to close a mill in British Columbia and eliminate a shift at another, curtailing 314M board ft. of production annually.
    • Lumber futures settled +4.4% today to $409.40 per 1,000 board ft. on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, capping a 34% rise so far this month; until the recent surge, lumber prices have been in the doldrums since collapsing from a record of $639 reached in May 2018.
    • More than 1B total board feet of production out of western Canada has been curtailed in recent weeks by mill owners, but West Fraser's big move announced late yesterday was the one the lumber market had awaited.
    • In all, at least six lumber producers in British Columbia, including West Fraser, Canfor (OTCPK:CFPZF) and Interfor (OTC:IFSPF), have said they would cut output this year.
    • Other relevant tickers include WY, PCH, RFP, LPX, OSB, OTCPK:WFSTF
     
     
     
     
    | 7:11 PM | 23 Comments
  • ZYME

    Zymeworks -4.7% after filing for $150M offering

    • Zymeworks (NYSE:ZYME) is 4.7% lower postmarket after filing a prospectus to offer $150M in shares and prefunded warrants.
    • Active book-running manager is J.P. Morgan, along with co-book-runners Wells Fargo and Stifel.
    • Net proceeds would go toward expanding development of ZW25 (as a single agent and in combination), expanding developing of ZW49 through an ongoing Phase 1 clinical trial and follow-on studies, for other novel preclinical programs and for general purposes.
    • The offering is set to trade on Thursday, Bloomberg says.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 2 Comments

  • RHE, BKI, MTSI and KURA among after hour movers

    • Gainers: RHE +7.3%. MFG +7.2%. RGA +5.1%. BKI +5%. PBI +4.7%.
    • Losers: MTSI -13.3%. KURA -8.4%. LZB -7%. SSRM -6.4%. CIH -5.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM | 8 Comments
  • JILL

    J. Jill +4.5% as director discloses share purchases

    • J. Jill (NYSE:JILL) is up 4.5% after hours, nearly wiping out today's regular session decline, after a filing disclosing that director James Scully bought more than $220,000 worth of shares.
    • Scully purchased 37,536 shares Friday at an average price of $1.5677, and bought another 98,867 shares yesterday at an average price of $1.7182.
    • The moves bring his direct beneficial ownership in the company at 189,293.67 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM | 7 Comments
  • UPWK

    Upwork gains as Cantor emerges bullish

    • Cantor Fitzgerald starts Upwork (NASDAQ:UPWK)Â at Overweight and a $19 PT, a 25% upside.
    • Upwork shares are up 0.9% after hours to $15.28.
    • UPWKÂ has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHKE

    Cherokee Global Brands -4.9% after guidance trimmed

    • Cherokee Global Brands (NASDAQ:CHKE)Â slides 4.9%Â in after-hours trading after cutting its guidance to account for potential effects of Brexit and tariff rate increases.
    • Now sees full-year revenue of $24.5M-$26.5M vs. prior view of $26.0M-$28.5M given in April; compares with sole analyst estimate of $27.2M.
    • Trims year adjusted EBITDA guidance to $10.5M-$11.5M from $11.0M-$12.5M.
    • Cherokee says it's taken steps to further reduce selling, general, and administrative expenses.
    • Q1 net loss of $2.26M, or 15 cents per share, narrowed from a loss of $2.74M, or 20 cents per share, in the year-ago quarter. Per-share loss compares with sole analyst estimate for a loss of 11 cents per share.
    • Revenue for the quarter ended May 4, 2019 of $5.05M slipped from $5.40M a year ago; falls short from the single analyst estimate of $5.73M.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • NCR

    NCR -6.5% as Apollo, Warburg walk - NYP

    • NCRÂ (NYSE:NCR)Â plunges 6.5% after hours following a New York Post report that PEÂ firms interested in purchasing the company have walked without a deal.
    • Sources say Warburg Pincus and Apollo Global Management (NYSE:APO) backed off in recent weeks, and no new bidder has stepped forward.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • JBL

    Jabil +2% on revenue beat, in-line view

    • Jabil (NYSE:JBL)Â +2.3%Â after a Q3 print that beat revenue estimates and met on EPS. The in-line Q4 outlook has revenue at $6.3-$6.9B (estimate: $6.42B) and EPSÂ of $0.76-0.96 (estimate: $0.87).
    • Revenue breakdown: Electronics Manufacturing, $3.99BÂ (+26% Y/Y; estimate: $4.01B); Diversified Manufacturing, $2.12B (-6% Y/Y; estimate: $2B).
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PMÂ ETÂ with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • IRWD

    Ironwood and Allergan report positive topline data for Linzess Phase IIIb

    • Ironwood Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IRWD) and Allergan (NYSE:AGN) report that Linzess (linaclotide) 290 mcg met its primary multi-component endpoint in a Phase IIIb study.
    • IronwoodÂ rises 7.7%Â in after-hours trading.
    • Trial demonstrated linaclotide improved overall abdominal symptoms of bloating, pain and discomfort in adult irritable bowl syndrome with constipation.
    • Also met secondary endpoints.
    • Linaclotide was well-tolerated in this Phase IIIb study, with the most commonly reported adverse event being diarrhea.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe +1.7% after Q2 beats, downside outlook

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE) gains 1.7% after Q2 beats with downside Q3 guidance that has revenue of $2.8B (estimate: $2.83B) and EPSÂ of $1.95 (estimate: $2.05).
    • Digital Media revenue was $1.89B versus the $1.86BÂ consensus and Digital Experience revenue came in at $784M (estimate: $774.7M).
    • Document cloud ARRÂ was $921M compared to the $900.5M estimate.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PMÂ ETÂ with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • CTRV

    Gyrating ContraVir Pharma on track for second biggest-ever one-day selloff

    • ContraVir Pharmaceuticals (CTRV -44.6%) plunges to cap off a whipsaw week that included encouraging results of drug studies and SEC filings showing the withdrawal, and the withdrawal of the withdrawal, of a share offering.
    • Today's catalyst was the pricing of a public offering of securities with $15.6M in expected proceeds; shares are now on track for their second biggest one-day selloff since CTRV started trading in February 2014.
    • The gyrations started last Tuesday with a 36% surge following the publication of research that found its CRV431 drug reduced hepatitis B virus DNA in mice liver.
    • The stock surrendered 16% the next day after the company took advantage of the previous session's gain to file to sell common and preferred shares as well as warrants to buy shares.
    • Shares soared 27% the next day after CTRV filed a Form RW, but the filing was made in error; after the market's June 13 close, the company filed a Form RWÂ WD - defined as a withdrawal of a registration withdrawal request - to request the immediate withdrawal of the withdrawal, which sent the stock down 12% on June 14.
    • CTRV then jumped 9% yesterday following upbeat findings from a first study involving its CRV431 drug candidate with human precision cut liver slice cultures.
    • All told, CTRV shares have lost 95% of their value over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 13 Comments

  • Stocks near session high ahead of the close

    • Thirty minutes before the bell, the Dow and Nasdaq areÂ ahead 1.5%, and the S&P 500Â 1%.
    • Dovish comments from ECB chief Mario Draghi overnight and hopes for a trade detente between the U.S. and China got things off on the right foot today.
    • The FOMC policy statement and press conference is set for tomorrow - most will be on the lookout for some sort of signal that a rate cut could be on the way.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 11 Comments
  • DPW

    DPW +17% as it refinances debt

    • Nanocap stock DPW Holdings (NYSEMKT:DPW)Â rises 17%Â on more than double its 3-month average daily volume after it refinances outstanding debt with the issuance of a secured, non-convertible promissory note for $2.9M.
    • Used gross proceeds of $2.8M to repay an outstanding convertible promissory note to the lender and used the rest to extinguish other short-term debt in the aggregate amount of ~$1M.
    • In consideration for the lender agreeing into the refinancing, DPW agreed to issue it 500,000 shares of common stock, subject to the approval by the NYSE American.
    • If DPW's stock holds on to the 17% gain, it would be the stock's biggest rise since March 25.
    • Previously: DPW Holdings cuts total debt YTD by $9M (April 11)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • ANSS

    Airbus, ANSYS team on autonomous drone controls

    • Airbus Defence and Space and ANSYS (NASDAQ:ANSS) will collaborate on a new ANSYSÂ solution to enable AI-backed, safety-critical flight controls for autonomous drone flights by 2030.
    • ANSSÂ shares are up 2%Â to $202.64.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • FITB

    Fifth Third boosts dividend, adopts 100M-share buyback authorization

    • Fifth Third Bancorp (FITB +2.8%) boosts its common stock quarterly dividend by 2 cents, or 9.1%, to 24 cents per share for Q2.
    • Board also approves a new share repurchase authorization of up to 100M shares, replacing its previous authorization from 2018, under which ~22M shares remain.
    • The new authorization doesn't have an expiration date.
    • Fifth Third's trailing 12-month dividend yield of 2.97% compares with financial sector median of 2.81%.
    • Dividend Scorecard
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • VSLR

    Vivint Solar's Q1 growth execution reaffirms confidence, BAML analyst says

    • Vivint Solar (VSLR +11.4%) is reiterated with a Buy rating and an increase price target of $12.50, up from $11.50, at BofAÂ Merrill Lynch, which says another quarter of healthy growth instills added confidence in the company achieving its 15% megawatt growth guidance in 2019 and even higher in 2020.
    • VSLR deployed 45.6 MW in Q1, slightly above the high end of company guidance, and announced a better than expected NPV of $0.99/watt, and management reiterated expectations of achieving a FY 2019 NPV in excess of $1.00/watt, says BAML analyst Julien Dumoulin-Smith.
    • A new report from the Solar Energy Industries Association and Wood Mackenzie raised its outlook for U.S. solar installations this year and beyond, sparking broad gains today across the spectrum of solar names.
    • VSLR's average Sell SideÂ Rating is Buy, while its Quant Rating is Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • SGMS

    Scientific Games +6% on Perelman's $2.17M buy

    • Scientific Games (NASDAQ:SGMS)Â gains after billionaire Ronald O. Perelman purchases 110K shares at $19.73 each.
    • Perelman, the top holder of SGMS, now has a 39% stake, according to Bloomberg data.
    • SGMSÂ shares are up 6.3%Â to $21 on the disclosure and overall tech rally on trade optimism.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM

  • SPWR, VSLR AND TDS among notable tech movers

    • Gainers:Â SunPower Corporation (NASDAQ:SPWR) +31%. Telephone and Data Systems (NYSE:TDS) +14%. VivoPower International (NASDAQ:VVPR) +15%. United States Cellular (NYSE:USM) +13%. Vivint Solar (NYSE:VSLR) +12%.
    • Losers:Â Digital Ally (NASDAQ:DGLY) -40%. Vislink Technologies (NASDAQ:VISL) -20%. Fastly (NYSE:FSLY) -6%. Cellcom Israel (NYSE:CEL) -6%. Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 2 Comments
  • SPWR

    SunPower, Sunrun spiking after Goldman Sachs upgrades to Buy

    • Shares of SunPower (SPWR +31.6%) and Sunrun (RUN +8.6%) shares are on fire after Goldman Sachs upgrades both to Buy from Neutral, hiking SPWR's price target to $11 from $6 and RUN to $20 from $15.
    • Goldman's Brian Lee says U.S. residential solar stocks are poised to benefit from "volume tailwinds" in H2 2019 given recent signs of strength in the sector's financing environment.
    • Among the key catalysts, Lee notes California's mandate for new home rooftop solar that will require every new home built in the state starting next year to have a solar system, and says the timing of the 30% federal ITC tax credit expected to be phased down to 26% next year related to solar power installation will drive "heavy solar installation volumes between now and 2023."
    • Lee also upgrades Solaredge Technologies (SEDG +4.7%) to Neutral from Sell with a $52 price target, raised from $35.
    • Also, a new report from the Solar Energy Industries Association and Wood Mackenzie raises its outlook for U.S. solar installations this year and beyond.
    • SPWR's average Sell Side Rating is Hold, while both its Seeking Alpha Authors' Rating and Quant Rating are Neutral.
    • RUN's average Sell Side Rating is Outperform and its Quant Rating is Neutral.
    • ETF: TAN
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 7 Comments
  • CINR

    Ciner Resources sinks after Chairman/CEO Milling resigns

    • Ciner Resources (CINR -7.4%) says Chairman, President and CEO Kirk Milling has resigned, effective immediately, to be succeeded by Oguz Erkan.
    • Milling joined Ciner's predecessor company in 1999 and has served as President and CEO since 2009.
    • Erkan currently is a director of Ciner's general partner and the company's Director of International Operations & Coordination.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 4 Comments

  • Sundance Energy Australia and Lonestar Resources among Energy/Materials gainers; Epsilon Energy and Ciner Resources among losers

    • Gainers:Â Sundance Energy Australia (NASDAQ:SNDE) +20%. Lonestar Resources (NASDAQ:LONE) +17%. Quintana Energy Services (NYSE:QES) +13%. Nabors Industries (NYSE:NBR) +10%. Midstates Petroleum (NYSE:MPO) +10%.
    • Losers:Â Epsilon Energy (NASDAQ:EPSN) -12%. Ciner Resources (NYSE:CINR) -9%. San Juan Basin Royalty Trust (NYSE:SJT) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • SJT

    No cash payout this month at San Juan Basin Royalty Trust

    • San Juan Basin Royalty Trust (SJT -5%) sinks after announcing it will not declare a monthly cash distribution to unitholders during June due to excess production costs in April.
    • SJT says the additional spending resulted largely from several well recompletions during the period combined with lower natural gas prices.
    • SJT reports its average gas price for April was $1.37/Mcf, compared with the March average of $2.00/Mcf.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM | 55 Comments
  • AGN

    Allergan +3.2% with Evercore seeing split more likely

    • Allergan (NYSE:AGN) has jumped in recent minutes, up 3.2%, as Evercore ISI notes the company seems to be headed toward a split of its aesthetics and therapeutics business.
    • After talking with the company's general counsel, Evercore's Umer Raffat reportedly says "I walked away with the sense that Allergan is heading towards a split and may likely lay out timelines ... We may get an update in 'next couple of months.' " (h/t Andrew Dunn)
    • Allergan had announced plans last May to sell its women's health and infectious disease businesses, before that effort stalled earlier this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 19 Comments
  • TSLA

    Model 3 production said to running below Musk's target

    • Tesla (TSLA +0.5%) is falling short of hitting Elon Musk's target of producing 1K Model 3 vehicles a day, according to Business Insider.
    • Leaked documents for one segment of Model 3 production indicate an average production rate of around 700 units per day since May 22.
    • Tesla is looking to match Q2 expectations and set a deliveries record for a quarter after a shortfall in Q1.
    • Shares of Tesla have pared an early gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM | 594 Comments

  • Sprint gains on report Dish is close to $6B asset deal

    • Sprint (NYSE:S) is legging up, +2.5%, on Bloomberg headlines saying Dish Network (DISH +2.2%) is close to a $6B deal to buy assets from Sprint and T-Mobile (TMUS +1.2%).
    • That's believed to be the key precondition for the Justice Dept. approving a $26B merger between Sprint and T-Mobile.
    • While a majority of FCC commissioners have indicated they'll approve the deal, the DOJ reportedly wants the combination to sell off Sprint's prepaid Boost Mobile line along with related spectrum that could help make a fourth national carrier.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM | 34 Comments
  • GCP

    GCP Applied Tech to go it alone as strategic review comes up empty

    • GCP Applied Technoliges (GCP -13.5%) plunges to three-year lows after saying its strategic alternatives review did not produce a transaction that would provide adequate value to shareholders.
    • After its review process engaged with industry players and private equity investors, GCP says it will now pursue a stand-alone strategic and financial plan while continuing to evaluate value opportunities.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM

  • Positive day for boating and RV stocks

    • Recreational vehicle stocks are gaining following positive news on the U.S.-China trade front and strong-than-anticipated boating registrations in May (per B. Riley).
    • Sentiment on the sector has been held back in general by tariff worries and the expectation that heavy rain across the U.S. this quarter hurt sales across boats, RVs and motorcycles.
    • Related stocks: Winnebago (WGO +2.8%), MasterCraft Boat Holdings (MCFT +2.5%), Polaris (PII +3.1%), REV Group (REVG +3.4%), LCI Industries (LCII +2.2%), Thor Industries (THO +1.5%), Harley-Davidson (HOG +1.2%), Camping World Holdings (CWH +2.3%), MarineMax (HZO +0.8%), Brunswick (BC +1.6%) and Patrick Industries (PATK +1.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM | 3 Comments

  • MoneyGram International leads financial gainers, Puyi and Ashford Hospitality Trust among losers

    • Gainers: MoneyGram International (NASDAQ:MGI) +103%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) +34%. Yintech Investment Holdings (NASDAQ:YIN) +7%. Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +7%. Innovative Industrial Properties (NYSE:IIPR) +6%.
    • Losers: Senmiao Technology (NASDAQ:AIHS) -40%. Ashford Hospitality Trust (NYSE:AHT) -7%. Puyi (NASDAQ:PUYI) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM

  • Hovnanian Enterprises and NN among industrial gainers; Aspen Aerogels and Hebron Technology in losers

    • Gainers:Â Euro Tech Holdings (NASDAQ:CLWT) +8%. Evoqua Water Technologies (NYSE:AQUA) +7%. NN (NASDAQ:NNBR) +6%. Hovnanian Enterprises (NYSE:HOV) +5%.
    • Losers:Â Hebron Technology (NASDAQ:HEBT) -6%. Aspen Aerogels (NYSE:ASPN) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • XOM

    WTI crude +3.5% as U.S.-China trade talks set to resume

    • Crude oil prices are surging after Pres. Trump said he would hold an "extensive meeting" with Chinese Pres. Xi at the G20 summit later this month; WTIÂ +3.6% to $53.82/bbl, Brent +2.1% to $62.22/bbl.
    • "Right now, this is a rumor-driven market," says Tradition Energy VP of research Gene McGillian. "There's the expectation that if you are able to reach a trade resolution, it would help global economic growth and therefore oil demand."
    • Tensions in the Middle East after last week's tanker attacks also lend support to crude prices.
    • Market participants also are awaiting a meeting between OPEC and other producers including Russia, possibly during July 10-12.
    • Energy names are broadly higher: XOM +1%, CVX +1.3%, RDS.A +1.4%, BP +1.5%, COP +1.7%, APA +1.8%, CHK +1.9%, PXD +2.2%, EOG +3.4%, CXO +3.4%, RIG +5.4%, OAS +7.4%, NBR +9.9%.
    • ETFs: USO, XLE, OIL, UWT, UCO, DWT, SCO, BNO, DBO, DTO, USL, OLO, SZO, OLEM, WTIU, OILK, OILX
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 79 Comments
  • IRDM

    Iridium, Icom unveil dedicated satellite PTT radio

    • Iridium (IRDM +1.9%) and Icom Inc. have announced commercial availability of the first dedicated satellite push-to-talk radio, the Icom IC-SAT100.
    • The device promises real-time instant communications between groups of individuals that can be anywhere on the planet -- offering business continuity and security for global customers that include not only enterprises but also government agencies and NGOs, first responders, law enforcement and search and rescue.
    • It interoperates with existing Land-Mobile Radio networks and can be managed over the air using Iridium's PTT Command Center.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 9 Comments

  • SPWR, GCP, TDS and BHVN among midday movers

    • Gainers:Â MoneyGram International (NASDAQ:MGI) +106%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) +33%. G1 Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GTHX) +26%. SunPower Corporation (NASDAQ:SPWR) +24%. Sundance Energy Australia (NASDAQ:SNDE) +20%. Cortexyme (NASDAQ:CRTX) +18%. Wah Fu Education Group (WAFU) +15%. Lonestar Resources (NASDAQ:LONE) +14%. Telephone and Data Systems (NYSE:TDS) +14%. Immuron Limited (NASDAQ:IMRN) +13%.
    • Losers:Â Digital Ally (NASDAQ:DGLY) -42%. ContraVir Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CTRV) -40%. Senmiao Technology (NASDAQ:AIHS) -37%. Rockwell Medical (NASDAQ:RMTI) -29%. Adynxx (OTC:ADYX) -25%. Vislink Technologies (NASDAQ:VISL) -23%. Biohaven Pharmaceutical Holding Company (NYSE:BHVN) -23%. GCP Applied Technologies (NYSE:GCP) -14%. Calithera Biosciences (NASDAQ:CALA) -14%. Zedge (NYSEMKT:ZDGE) -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • BA

    Boeing scores order for 200 737 MAX planes in big vote of confidence

    • Boeing (BA +3.8%) gets a big boost at the Paris Air Show as British Airways owner IAG signed a letter of intent to buy 200 of its 737 MAX aircraft, the first deal for the plane since its grounding in March.
    • Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY -0.1%), the current supplier of British Airways, reportedly was stunned by the deal worth $24B at list prices, which came months after it lost a major IAG wide-body aircraft order to the U.S. company; Airbus may not have been offered a chance to bid, Reuters reports, citing industry sources.
    • "We have every confidence in Boeing and expect that the aircraft will make a successful return to service in the coming months," IAG CEO Willie Walsh says of the 737 MAX.
    • After Boeing ended the initial session of the air show with no new orders, the company earlier announced a commitment from Korean Air to buy 20 787 Dreamliners and Air Lease said it would purchase five 787-9 Dreamliners.
    • Shares also likely are benefiting from apparent progress on the trade front with China, as Pres. Trump says he will meet with Pres. Xi at the upcoming G20 summit.
    • #ParisAirShow2019
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 259 Comments
  • STZ

    Guggenheim gloom weighs on Constellation Brands

    • Constellation Brands (STZ -2.8%) falls after Guggenheim dials up the caution in a new note.
    • The Guggenheim analyst team points to poor weather trends and thinks Corona promotions could weigh on FQ1 results. Looking further down the road, risk associated with STZ's Canopy investment is highlighted.
    • Shares of Constellation Brands are down 11% over the last month.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 21 Comments
  • SIEGY

    Siemens gas and power business to cut 2,700 jobs

    • Siemens (OTCPK:SIEGY +2.1%) cites the need for savings of €500M ($559M) in the business to improve competitiveness as it announces planned cuts of 2,700 jobs at its gas and power company.
    • Restructuring would save €200M, cutting support functions another €200M and a new regional structure a further €100M, the company says.
    • Siemens said last month it is targeting cost cuts of €2.2B by 2023 through cutting 10,400 jobs, mainly administration and support roles, at its remaining core units.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • GE

    GE expects north of $35B in orders at Paris Air Show

    • General Electric (GE +2.2%) enjoys strong gains as its aviation division books $24B in orders for its engines on day one of the Paris Air Show, including a $20B order with IndiGo Airlines, and GE says it expects at least $35B in orders at the show.
    • GE also confirms its GE Capital Aviation Services won a deal with Amazon to lease 15 737-800 Boeing cargo aircraft, as the online retailer pushes more into controlling its own supply chain.
    • Also, long-time GE bear John Inch of Gordon Haskett says he does not think GE risks insolvency stemming from another round of fall 2018-like credit rating downgrades.
    • "It's highly unlikely that would happen," Inch tells Yahoo Finance. "GE has privately said the credit ratings agencies are happy and comfortable with their liquidity plans for the next 18 months. I think that has bought them a lot of breathing room and time."
    • #ParisAirShow2019
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 97 Comments

  • Energous and NIO among consumer gainers

    • Gainers:Â Youngevity International (NASDAQ:YGYI) +7%. NIO (NYSE:NIO) +7%. Planet Green Holdings (NYSEMKT:PLAG) +7%. Energous (NASDAQ:WATT) +6%. The Lovesac Company (NASDAQ:LOVE) +6%.
    • Losers: None
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM

  • TDS +13% amid Morgan Stanley upgrades

    • Telephone and Data Systems (NYSE:TDS) is up 13.1% on its own upgrade from Morgan Stanley to Overweight, from Equal Weight.
    • The firm had given a similar upgrade to subsidiary U.S. Cellular (USM +11.8%), noting an "ideal" time for the mobile unit to monetize a 4,000-plus tower portfolio.
    • It's raised the price target on TDS to $47.50 from $33, now implying 44% upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM

  • Analysts react to Tempur Sealy-Mattress Firm reunion

    • SunTrust warns that Tempur Sealy International's (TPX -0.7%)Â outlook after factoring in the return of the Mattress Firm business is below some high-flying estimates. The firm keeps a Hold rating and price target of $70.
    • Bank of America Merrill is much more bullish on the TPX outlook update. "We see today’s announcement as a positive for the industry on the whole as it should ensure Mattress Firm will stick to rational pricing behavior. In the two years following the split with TPX, Firm engaged in very irrational pricing behavior which in part led the company into bankruptcy," reads the BAML note.
    • BAML thinks the Tempur Sealy-Mattress Fim development is a negative for Sleep Number (SNBR -0.5%), as it significantly expands distribution for the Tempur which it believes has high overlap with SNBR.
